column4: I have a emachine em250 netbook, which is identical to the acer aspire d250, my question is i'm trying to find out what temp the cpu is running at, but in /proc/acpi/thermal_zone/THRM , temperature only reads at 27C and does not change
have you tried it after boot from a cold system?
yeah i have even on a cold boot it is 27C right away
are you worried it is to hot or just curious?
worried at times... it does get rather warm
well then we need to figure this out! You need a graphical toolbar so you can keep an eye on it.
19-year-old Isaac Holdsambeck was driving a Ford F-350 with four passengers when he swerved off the northbound lane of Hampton Cove Way.
oops my bad.
what could cause it to not read the temp
Do you have access to synaptic?
ha.. i was wondering
i will install it quick
Xsensors reads temp and voltage
ok i just installed Xsensors, I have it open and right now it just shows a temp, and that is 26.8C
man am I good or what!
just kidding
the temp doesn't change though
what is the operation range for that puter? 27C seems ok to me
do you run Gnome? Computertemp applet logs changes
Mine is 56 C

i do run gnome, also it is adjusting the fan to the temp as it gets warmer the fan is speeding up so that is a good sign i suppose, but it still says its at 27C, also acpi -V shows the cpu at 26.8C also
hmm... i getting some results on google saying it is a bug in the kernel with the intel atom processors, but i'm still digging
